snippet: The self-improvement industry thrives on New Year’s resolutions gone awry. After all, if you don’t lose those pounds or stop smoking this year, you’ll probably try again in 2013.
abstract: Self-improvement industry thrives on New Year’s resolutions gone awry; Americans were projected to spend $62 billion in 2011 on self-improvement in the hope of keeping resolutions; some stop-smoking and weight-loss programs, as well as gyms, are trying to help for the long haul, a strategy that can improve customers' chances of success and build brand loyalty and revenue.
lead_paragraph: The self-improvement industry thrives on New Year’s resolutions gone awry. After all, if you don’t lose those pounds or stop smoking this year, you’ll probably try again in 2013.

headline.seo: New Year’s Resolutions, Recycled, Are a Boon for Business
headline.main: Your Recycled Resolutions Are a Boon for Business
